entry.title: How to find CDS views in S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition
entry.content:
TLDR

With 3-tier S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition you can now connect your ABAP Developer Tools (ADT, in Eclipse) directly to the system.  You can browse development objects including CDS views. Creating an ABAP Repository Tree allows you to browse by component and release status, to find released views to use in your extensions

Remind me, what is S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition?

S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition (or Public CE) is SAP's SaaS ERP. Formerly known as S/4HANA Cloud, and as S/4HANA Public Cloud, this flavour of S/4 emphasises a tight fit to standard business processes.  The solution is hosted and managed by SAP. Only clean-core extensions are possible and upgrades happen according to a published schedule

Why does S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition matter?

Whilst the largest customers tend to draw most of the limelight in the SAP world, there are only so many of them.  As you widen your gaze to include progressively smaller and smaller customers their number increases more than proportionately.  In other words there are a lot more companies with 10,000 employees that there are with 100,000 employees.  There are a heck of a lot more companies with 1000 employees that there are with 10,000. This means that the total market is huge, even if each individual subscription is smaller

Ceteris paribus, these smaller customers are more likely to go for Public CE, because it can be more cost effective for them.  Indeed the inability to perform 'dirty' extensions & enhancements, and the inability to stay on a outdated release can be seen as advantages of Public CE.  SAP's vision is that over time more and more customers will switch to Public CE, some after 'cleaning up' their legacy enhancements.  They hope that, over time, larger and larger customers will sign up

How can we extend S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition?

Whilst a fit to standard processes is the goal, Public CE can be extended and enhanced if needed.  There might be a small variation to fit a competitive advantage that that particular customer has, their 'special sauce' if you like.  Historically these extensions could be categorised as

  1. On-stack key-user extensions

  2. Side-by-side developer-built extensions on BTP

To support the latter type we expose data via the SAP-standard published APIs, by creating custom CDS views or by creating custom business objects with a back-end service enabled. Events can also trigger extensions on BTP

Why are released views precious?

To expose standard data that isn't part of a published API we must (if 2-tier) use the custom CDS view option. We can only use released views as sources, and only a fraction of views are released.  Why is that?  Well, releasing a view is a big deal for SAP because it represents a promise to keep that view available and up to date.  If this wasn't the case our extensions could break every upgrade cycle, as standard views or fields on standard views were removed.  This would limit the viability of Public CE altogether 

Hence finding released views with the right data is an important part of extension design.  Happily, that task is getting easier, with the increased prevalence of the 3-tier landscape with Public CE

Why are 3 tiers better than 2?

When my first customer went live with Public CE in 2019 all setups had Test and Prod environments only.  Having a background at big on-prem customers, with their 5 or 6 tier landscapes (e.g. Sandbox / Dev / Test / Pre-Prod / Prod / Training) I found this pretty scary!

Now all new Public CE customers get 3 tiers ( Dev / Test / Prod ) and existing customers are being migrated.  The Dev environment has 2 tenants, for development and for customizing. Under the hood, these represent client 80 and client 100. This facilitates the introduction of a new enhancement technique.  Using the embedded ABAP Cloud environment we can use RAP (the ABAP Restful Programming Model) to build OData services. This gives far greater flexibility that we get building custom CDS views in a Fiori app (as a 'key-user')

This on-stack extensibility was known for a while as Embedded Steampunk

Of course, finding released CDS views is still important, because ABAP cloud will only allow us to use released CDS views as data sources. So what's the best way to find them?

What's the best way to find released CDS views in a 3-tier Public CE landscape?

Once you've connected your ABAP Development Tools to your S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition system (development tenant/client 80) you can browse all of the development objects.  This is something that just wasn't possible before, because we were limited to what we could see in various Fiori apps

If you try to browse all of the CDS views, you will likely hit an issue as there are just too many to be rendered.  I recommend instead building your own ABAP Repository Tree (via File->New).

On the first screen (of the repo tree wizard) select Core Data Services

On the next screen, in the Selected Tree Levels, remove package from level 3, and replace it with Application Component.  Then select drag the API State level over to level 4.

Click Finish. Now, in the tree, you can open Core Data Services, Data Definitions and then the component of your choice.  The released views are found under USE_IN_CLOUD_DEVELOPMENT. You can open the individual view to see the definition.

You can confirm that the view is released by considering the API State tab in the properties, on the bottom right of your Eclipse screen. C1 Use System Internally is the key part.  If it is Released you should be able to use this view in a custom CDS view or in RAP development

Because you are connected to your dev system you can see the release status of every view which is available on your current release

What do you think?

Are you an expert on extensions already?  Or are you surprised at how much scope there is for extension on S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition?  Extensions certainly got a little easier, now that we can see every view available. Let me know in the comments what you think, and if you have any tips for finding views

I would love to find a good way to find CDS views which use a given table as a source (directly or indirectly).  This can be done in the View Browser app, but we won't see all of the views. Perhaps in future SAP could support using the where-used feature in ADT

entry.title: Finance with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
Hello finance experts! I'm happy to share a number of latest innovation highlights delivered with our SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 for finance.

If you’re looking for a quick summary of the top Finance release highlights for version 2508 – check out my video.

For a full overview of all the release highlights, please see the table of contents below.

 

Video 1. Release Highlight Video for Finance in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508

Table of contents

This update highlights significant innovations in the following areas:

SAP Business AI in FInance

  • Generally available AI capabilities
  • AI-assisted business insights (quick actions) in the review booklets

Asset Accounting

  • AI-assisted explanation of fixed asset key figures (+▶️demo video)
  • Generative AI capability: creating fixed asset master data (+▶️demo video)

Receivables Management

  • Dispute Resolution for Receivable Items (+▶️demo video)

Payments and Bank Communications

  • AI-assisted payment exception analysis (+▶️demo video)
  • Cross bank area intercompany payments (+▶️demo video)

Overhead Accounting

  • Event-Based Settlement from Investment Projects to Assets under Construction

Financial Planning and Analysis

  • Universal Component Breakdown in the plan and actual value flow
  • Cost of Goods Manufactured – Review Booklet
  • Product Profitability Review Booklet
  • Company Profitability Review Booklet (Template)

General Ledger Accounting

  • Default profit center per company code

Revenue and Cost Accounting

  • Ability to recognize revenue based on a current foreign currency exchange rate in fixed-price customer projects
  • Event-based revenue recognition for sales orders with milestone billing and third-party drop shipment scenarios
  • Leveraging SAP Subscription Billing with universal revenue recognition

Cash and Liquidity Management

  • Bank account unique IDs for efficient cross-system management
  • Overdraft limits in the Short-Term Cash Positioning app
  • Mass Upload of Different Memo Record Types in One File
  • Treasury End-of-Day Bank Statement Reconciliation

Financing with Taulia

  • Receivables financing: sell outstanding trade receivables with cash dominion
  • Dynamic discounting: enable suppliers to receive early payment on outstanding invoices (self-funded) with credit memo

Contract Accounting

  • Dunning by collection strategy on provider contract item level
  • Subledger Transfer of documents from FI-CA to FI-AR/AP
  • Clearing Status in Business Partner Line items

Group Reporting

  • One-click consolidation in a new consolidation monitor (cloud)
  • Consolidation auto-post rules engine: automation of consolidation unit dependent postings
  • Consolidation auto-post rules engine: automation of inter-company eliminations postings

Contract and Lease Management

  • Cost settlement for real estate scenarios, such as automated cost classification

SAP Green Ledger

  • Enriching material movements from SAP S/4HANA with imported emission quantities (+▶️demo video)
  • Enabling automatic allocations of carbon quantities by reflecting allocations in financial accounting (+▶️demo video)
  • Posting and analysis of carbon quantities on external suppliers and affiliated companies

 

SAP Business AI in Finance

We start off with the overview of the SAP Business AI news. Release 2508 brings several AI innovations increasing your efficiency, automating your tasks and improving your decision making.

  • AI-assisted explanation of fixed asset key figures
  • Generative AI capability: creating fixed asset master data
  • Communication Intelligence for Dispute Management (Enterprise Service Management)
  • AI-assisted payment exception analysis

In addition, AI-assisted business insights (quick actions) are now accessible in the following review booklets:

  • Cost Centers Review Booklet 
  • Project Financial Booklet – Professional Services
  • Group Financial Statements Review Booklet

Back to top

Let’s continue with the topic covered in the release video:

Asset Accounting

AI-assisted explanation of fixed asset key figures

Ever find yourself looking at a key figure for a fixed asset and wishing you had a quick way to understand the underlying calculation? We've designed a feature to bring you that clarity exactly when you need it.

With the AI-generated explanation for fixed asset key figures, you can now demystify complex calculations with the click of a button. This intelligent capability provides a clear, natural language explanation that details the origin of the displayed values and the logic behind how they are calculated.

For instance, if you need to understand precisely how a depreciation value was determined for a mid-year acquisition using a specific depreciation key, the AI will generate a detailed, easy-to-follow breakdown for you. This is all about empowering you to interpret your financial data with greater confidence and efficiency.

Value Proposition

  • Reduce the time to understand the calculated key figures of fixed assets, such as accumulated depreciation and net book value
  • Better understand the fixed asset valuation in detail and determine why unexpected value changes have occurred, for example, when special depreciation for a fixed asset has been posted by accident
  • Improve business users’ productivity by more easily understanding the asset and depreciation values

 

Video 2. Demo: AI-assisted explanation of fixed asset key figures

Capabilities 

  • Use SAP Business AI to better understand the calculation of fixed asset key figures such as depreciation values displayed in the value display section of the SAP Fiori app “Manage Fixed Assets,” resulting in efficiency and better decision-making for asset accounting and financial reporting
  • Let generative AI explain the rationale behind the system’s calculations of fixed asset values in a user-friendly and easier-to-understand natural language for business users

For more information, see: AI-Generated Explanation of Key Figures and AI features for asset accounting

Back to top

Generative AI capability: creating fixed asset master data

Another recent standout innovation in the area of Asset Accounting is the introduction of AI-assisted asset master data creation. This new capability fundamentally transforms a traditionally structured process into a dynamic, conversational experience.

Powered by SAP Business AI, this feature allows you to create asset master records using natural, everyday language. Think of it as having an expert assistant built right into your system, making the entire process more intuitive and intelligent.

Value Proposition

  • Reduce the time and effort required to create asset master data compared to navigating through a complex traditional SAP Fiori app
  • Reduce time for large-scale trainings and enable faster end-user onboarding
  • Reduce errors and ensure greater accuracy and better data governance of fixed asset master data through conversational data entry procedures
  • Increase business user productivity and satisfaction by enabling users to quickly enter and manage data in conversations

Capabilities 

  • Use SAP Business AI to create asset master data using simple, user-friendly, conversational commands in natural language
  • Provide instant support and feedback on asset master data creation
  • Help users troubleshoot issues and instantly learn best practices

Video 3. Simplify Asset Accounting with SAP Business AI and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (opens in a new window)

For more information, see:  Creating fixed asset master data and AI features for asset accounting

Back to top

Receivables Management         

Dispute Resolution for Receivable Items

Let’s have a look at the much-anticipated dispute resolution functionality. This marks the first step in a series of enhancements aimed at transforming how we approach collection management.

Use the new dispute resolution process to efficiently handle financial disputes and minimize their impact on operations and profitability.

Here's a sneak peek into what makes it so effective:

  • Smart user assignment: with rule-based determination, assign business users responsible for handling the dispute process automatically to ensure that each case is managed by the right person.
  • Intelligent attribute determination: attributes are determined automatically based on predefined rules.
  • Guided processing: the process is streamlined with step-by-step guidance.
  • Seamless accounts receivable Integration: this process integrates seamlessly with accounts receivable accounting, ensuring your financial records are always up to date.

Value Proposition

  • Increase efficiency by minimizing manual intervention and accelerating operations through automated workflows and integrated interfaces
  • Achieve scalability and flexibility with software that adapts to changing business needs and specific processes
  • Reduce costs by lowering operating expenses and avoiding errors and redundant tasks through optimized processes
  • Help ensure a smooth implementation without major downtime through an intuitive user interface and comprehensive support

 

Video 4. Demo: dispute resolution

Capabilities

  • Automatic and manual creation of disputes for receivable items
  • Rule-based determination of business users responsible for the process
  • Rule-based determination of attributes
  • Guided processing of disputes
  • Automatic (rule-based) and manual escalation process
  • Dispute-handling and decision-making process supported by amount validations
  • Process integration with accounts receivable accounting

For more information, see: Dispute Resolution for Receivable Items

Back to top

Payments and Bank Communications

AI-assisted payment exception analysis

SAP's latest enhancement to the Manage Automatic Payments app (ID: F0770) introduces a game-changing feature that empowers businesses to analyze payment exceptions post-payment proposal run, enriched with AI-driven suggested resolutions.

Value Proposition

  • Improve efficiency of payment exception resolution
  • Increase transparency by providing a history change log in payment proposals to end users and auditors

Video 5. Beta: AI-Assisted Payment Exception Analysis (opens in a new window)

Capabilities

  • Provide generated analysis for payment exceptions
  • Propose recommended resolution for the exceptions
  • Provide end users with filtered log items relevant for the exceptions

This feature is part of our Beta program.

Back to top

Cross bank area intercompany payments

Cross bank area payment scenario facilitates transactions between subsidiaries with accounts in different bank areas by designating one bank area as the clearing bank area. This setup is useful for efficiently managing and reconciling payments across multiple banking regions.
As a result, the following payment scenarios are supported:

  • Intercompany payment between two bank areas where none of them is defined as clearing bank area.
  • Intercompany payment between clearing bank area and non-clearing bank area.

Value Proposition

  • Enables payment processing across different bank areas in a simplified and direct way
  • Allows the originator and recipient of payments to be located in different bank areas
  • Permits cashless payments across bank areas

 

Video 6. Demo: cross bank area payment scenario

Capabilities 

  • Prerequisite is the definition of a central bank area
  • All participating bank areas hold a loro account at this bank area
  • If a cross-bank areas intercompany payment is detected, an additional turn over transaction for these loro accounts will be generated

For more information, see: Cross Bank Area Payments

Back to top

Overhead Accounting

Event-Based Settlement of Investment Projects to Assets under Construction

With event-based settlement, there is no need for periodic settlement any longer. All postings to the investment project are settled directly to the asset under construction (AuC) in full. Line item details are still available for the asset under construction and even for the fixed asset after the final settlement.

Value Proposition

  • Reduced period-end closing efforts
  • Detailed real-time reporting for the asset under construction and investment project
  • Tracking of posting history in detail (for example, for auditing purposes)

Picture 1. Event-Based Settlement of Investment Projects to Assets under Construction

Capabilities 

  • Simple activation by configuration of investment profile
  • Posted costs are directly settled to the asset under construction
  • After asset completion, costs can be settled from the asset under construction to the final asset
  • Detailed line item reporting available for the asset under construction and the final asset (even without line item settlement)
  • All postings on the final asset can be traced back from fixed asset to investment project

For more information, see: Event-Based Settlement

If you’re looking for more details, please read this blog: Settlement of Investment Projects in SAP Cloud ERP

Back to top

Financial Planning and Analysis

Universal Component Breakdown in the plan and actual value flow: determining, updating and reporting on product cost breakdowns

The UCB solution provides comprehensive transparency into cost of goods manufactured (COGM) and cost of goods sold (COGS) for in-house production products. It informs the cost factors at cost component level, based on origin cost component structure and production cost component structure, to drive improvements in contribution margins and to make competitive sales pricing decisions.

Value Proposition

  • Optimization of contribution margins by identifying the impact of origin cost factors changes on product profitability.
  • Data-driven improvement on product price decisions and product profitability.
  • End-to-end visibility into cost breakdown along the plan and actual value chain.

Picture 2. Price with component breakdown. Table view

Picture 3. Price with component breakdown. Diagram view

Capabilities:

  • Determine product cost breakdown, based on both origin cost and production cost component structure, in plan value flow for plan cost rate, and material standard cost estimates.
  • Explain material prices with component breakdown based on UCB.
  • Use new report COGM Review Booklet to analyze production costs based on origin and production cost component structures to improve cost efficiency.
  • View COGS breakdown for product sold either based on the origin cost breakdown structure or the production cost breakdown structure in product profitability analysis to identify the impacts of primary cost changes (energy, wages, depreciation) on product profitability.

For more information, see: Universal Component Breakdown

Back to top

Now let’s have a look at the new members in the Review Booklet family.

Cost of Goods Manufactured – Review Booklet

The COGM Review Booklet is part of the Universal Component Breakdown solution. With this new app, you can display, analyze, and validate the cost of goods manufactured (COGM) based on event-based manufacturing orders (order category 10 and 40).

Value Proposition

  • Provides insightful analysis capabilities for cost of goods manufactured of semi and finished products. 
  • Identifies the original cost factors to drive manufacturing operation efficiency and to control the total production costs.

Picture 4. Cost of Goods Manufactured – Review Booklet

Capabilities 

  • Display actual cost of goods manufactured using two component breakdown methods: Production Cost Breakdown and Origin Cost Breakdown.
  • View cost of goods manufactured based on cost component hierarchical view to understand sub-total costs by grouping multiple cost components.
  • Analyze production costs with component breakdown based on predefined pages: ‘Year-to-Date’ and ‘Period Comparisons’.

Check original cost factor details like origin material, origin activity and posting G/L account for each cost component.

For more information, see Cost of Goods Manufactured - Review Booklet

Back to top

Product Profitability Review Booklet

The new Product Profitability Review Booklet app provides a contribution margin view of product profitability across various dimensions and a detailed breakdown of cost of goods sold (COGS), showing fixed and variable cost components using Universal Component Breakdown methods.

Value Proposition

  • Enhance decision-making with multi-dimensional margin analysis via review booklet tech
  • Enable better cost tracking with detailed COGS breakdowns


Picture 5. Product Profitability Review Booklet. Margin overview

Picture 6. Product Profitability Review Booklet. COGS breakdown

Capabilities 

  • View YTD margins for sold products via contribution margin structure
  • Get detailed COGS insights with Production and Origin Cost Breakdowns

For more information, see Product Profitability Review Booklet

Back to top

Company Profitability Review Booklet (Template)

This review booklet enables you, as a Sales Accountant, to analyze the profitability of a company code.

Value Proposition

  • Implement best-practice-based contribution margin reporting for company codes.

Picture 7. Company Profitability Review Booklet (Template)

Capabilities

New reporting app based on a review booklet enables sales accountants to analyze the profitability of a company code structuring revenues and costs of good sold using a contribution margin view on different levels and different time dimensions:

  • Contribution margin I: shows the variable COGS at the product level
  • Contribution margin II: considers the fixed COGS sold at the product group level
  • Contribution margin III: takes into account the fixed costs at the company code level

For more information, see Company Profitability Review Booklet (Template)

Back to top

General Ledger Accounting    

Default profit center per company code

Enables the definition of default profit center per company code using the “Edit Constant for Nonassigned Processes (120100)” configuration activity.

Value Proposition

  • Increases system flexibility and configurability by opening up additional configuration capabilities in addition to only defining default profit centers per controlling area
  • Reduces the manual effort needed to adjust postings on profit centers
  • Enables the creation of financial reporting on profit centers

PIcture 8. Assignment of Profit Center - Company Code

Capabilities 

Enable the definition of default profit center per company code in the “Edit Constant for Nonassigned Processes (120100)” configuration activity

When no profit center can be derived for a business process from other channels, you can use a default profit center per company code in the posting.

For more information, see Edit Constant for Nonassigned Processes.

Back to top

Revenue and Cost Accounting

Ability to recognize revenue based on a current foreign currency exchange rate in fixed-price customer projects

Use revenue recognition key SPFCFX for the integration with Customer Projects (CPM) with fixed-price projects to provide revenue recognition data based on current FX rates for CPM projects planned with a foreign currency.

Value Proposition

  • Automate revenue recognition for recurring revenue scenarios
  • Enable compliance with international accounting standards

Picture 9. Event-Based Revenue Recognition – Projects: currency effects

Capabilities

  • Use the new revenue recognition key SPFCFX for fixed-price customer projects with cost-based percentage of completion (POC) to recognize revenue based on a current foreign currency exchange rate with the following features:
  • Use the project (object) currency as principal currency in event-based revenue recognition
  • Calculate the cost-based POC based on the company code currency with planned cost and revenue being determined by the plan source utilized in the configuration of event-based revenue recognition
  • Use the exchange rate of currency type M relevant at the first day within a financial period for real-time revenue recognition postings and postings from the period-end close (at month end or during manual revaluation)
  • Use the actual exchange rate of currency type M, which is also utilized in the deferred revenue postings in event-based revenue recognition, for general ledger postings on the customer project, such as customer invoices
  • Calculate and post currency effects during period-end close (SlalitType 8201) in company code currency and global currency, applying a FIFO (first in, first out) logic as the difference between accrued and deferred revenue posted with different currency exchange rates
  • Post the currency effects against the general ledger account defined in the configuration of event-based revenue recognition based on usage 400 (currency effects)
  • Display currency effects in the SAP Fiori app “Event-Based Revenue Recognition – Projects”


For more information, see: New Currency Handling Method in Event-Based Revenue Recognition for Fixed-Price Customer Projects

Back to top

Event-based revenue recognition for sales orders with milestone billing and third-party drop shipment scenarios

With this release, you can now use sales orders with a milestone billing plan for both sell-from-stock (sales and distribution order item category CBAO) and third-party drop shipment (item categories DB1 and DB2) scenarios in combination with Event-Based Revenue Recognition based on the completed contract method (revenue recognition key: SFSCCM).

Value Proposition

  • Streamline milestone billing for sell-from-stock and third-party drop shipment scenarios with event-based revenue recognition

Picture 10. Milestone billing in event-based revenue recognition

Capabilities

  • Use sales orders with a milestone billing plan for sell-from-stock (sales and distribution order item category CBAO) and third-party drop shipment (item categories DB1 and DB2) scenarios in combination with event-based revenue recognition based on the completed contract method (revenue recognition key: SFSCCM)


For more information, see: Milestone Billing for Sell-from-Stock and Drop Shipment Processes in Event-Based Revenue Recognition

Back to top

Leveraging SAP Subscription Billing with universal revenue recognition

If you are using Provider Contracts for Sales Billing, now it can be integrated with Universal Revenue Recognition, which can enable you to create performance obligations and perform revenue allocation based on standalone selling price.

Value Proposition

  • Automate revenue recognition for recurring revenue scenarios
  • Enable compliance with international accounting standards

Picture 11. Universal revenue recognition for SAP Subscription Billing

Capabilities

  • Use combined features of event-based revenue recognition and revenue accounting by activating universal revenue recognition (URR) for the integration with SAP Subscription Billing
  • Use revenue recognition key PPCA (Provider Contracts 365 Days Calendar Year and No Cost deferred) in combination with the deferral method in revenue accounting to recognize revenue over time
  • Define a standalone selling price with predefined condition type PSAS in SAP Subscription Billing to perform revenue allocation

For more information, see: Universal Revenue Recognition for Provider Contracts

Back to top

Cash and Liquidity Management  

Bank account unique IDs for efficient cross-system management

To facilitate efficient data distribution across systems especially for two-tier scenarios, you can choose to implement bank account unique IDs to enable the unique identification of a bank account throughout your network of integrated systems. This facilitates efficient data management across platforms, reduces replication complexity, and enhances the consistency of bank account master data. 

Value Proposition

  • Streamline bank account management by providing a unified approach to track and handle bank accounts across systems
  • Improve data traceability through the introduction of universally unique identifiers (bank account unique ID and origin system)
  • Help ensure reliable replication of bank account data across diverse system environments with accuracy and consistency
  • Resolve semantic inconsistencies by addressing challenges posed by varying key attributes for the same bank account across systems, such as different bank keys for the same bank in different systems

Picture 12. Schedule Jobs for Generating Bank Account Unique IDs (F8393)

 Capabilities

  • Use the new app Schedule Jobs for Generating Bank Account Unique IDs (F8393) and new configuration activity Enable Generation of Bank Account Unique IDs (106994) to set up bank account unique IDs for your bank accounts
  • Use the new attributes bank account unique ID and bank account origin system to uniquely distinguish bank accounts across systems and simplify data distribution
  • Integrate both attributes into bank account apps and processes, including the Manage Bank Accounts app, importing and exporting functionality, and data replication of bank accounts using intermediate document (IDoc) messages

For more information, see: Working with Bank Account Unique IDs

Back to top

Overdraft limits in the Short-Term Cash Positioning app

In the Manage Bank Accounts (F1366A) app, two new attributes - overdraft category and overdraft type - are introduced to enhance the overdraft limit function. With SAP's predefined overdraft categories, you can configure overdraft types based on your business requirements. Overdraft limits that are assigned to the overnight overdraft category can be consumed and displayed in the Short-Term Cash Positioning (F5380) app.

Value Proposition

  • Improve flexibility by supporting multiple overdraft categories and types (for example, overnight, daylight, and others), enabling cash managers to manage and reflect detailed overdraft agreements with banks
  • Enhance liquidity management by integrating overdraft limits into cash position profiles and the Short-Term Cash Positioning app, making them visible in cash positioning
  • Streamline oversight by providing better visibility of overdraft limits of bank accounts, improving operational efficiency, and reducing financial risk

Picture 13. Short-Term Cash Positioning (F5380): overdraft limit

Capabilities 

  • Support different types of overdraft limits in the Manage Bank Accounts app to accommodate detailed agreements with banks Introduce overdraft categories and types for increased flexibility
  • Provide settings in the Define Cash Position Profiles app to enable the display of overnight overdraft limits and unused overdraft limits directly in the Short-Term Cash Positioning app
  • Address the need for better overdraft limit visibility following the deprecation of the Bank Account Balance – By Balance Profile app

For more information, see Bank Account Overdraft Limits: New Configuration and Consumption in Cash Position

Back to top

Mass Upload of Different Memo Record Types in One File

  • You can now use the new generic template for memo records import in the Import Memo Records 2.0 app. Previously, you could only import memo records that have the same memo record type, now with the generic template, you can prepare memo record data with different memo record types and import them in one go. 
  • Value Proposition
    • Increase efficiency for importing memo records with different types
    • Minimize the risk of mishandling multiple files, such as missed uploads, by consolidating memo record data into a single file for import

Picture 14. Import Memo Records 2.0: generic template

Capabilities

  • A generic template that accommodates multiple memo record types can be downloaded.
  • Memo record data with different memo record types can be maintained in one file and imported in one go.
  • If any memo record in the file encounters a problem during the import, the entire upload will fail, and no memo records will be imported. Notification will be sent out once the import succeeds or fails for the entire file. 

For more information, see: Import Memo Records 2.0

Back to top

Treasury End-of-Day Bank Statement Reconciliation

Cash flow reconciliation with end-of-day bank statements and intraday bank statements has been enhanced with additional configuration options and enriched features. For end-of-day bank statements, you could now reconcile with a broader range of forecasted cash flows, define derivation logic for planning levels, and use queries with origin B (From Bank Statement Text Information) to derive liquidity items. Furthermore, you can now take bank status codes into consideration when generating bank statement flows for both end-of-day and intraday bank statements.

Value Proposition

  • Allow cash managers to eliminate forecasts that have already been confirmed to improve the accuracy of cash positions
  • Derive meaningful information from bank provided data to provide deeper insights on cash flow analysis

Picture 15. End of day bank statement: cash flows

Capabilities 

  • In addition to memo records 2.0 and residual flows, accounting cash flows with certainty level "Cash in Transit", "Regular Receivables" and "Regular Payables" can now be used as forecasted cash flows in cash flow reconciliation with end-of-day bank statements.
  • Configuration for deriving planning levels of end-of-day bank statement flows from bank transaction code.
  • Support using queries with origin B (From Bank Statement Text Information) to derive liquidity items for end-of-day bank statement flows.

For more information, see: Enhancements for Cash Flow Reconciliation

Back to top

Financing with Taulia  

Receivables financing: sell outstanding trade receivables with cash dominion

A new financing type, Limited Recourse (True Sale), Cash Dominion, Disclosed, has been introduced for the receivables financing process. With this financing arrangement, the customer is notified about the sale of receivables and pays for financed and non-financed invoices directly into the funder's collection account.

Value Proposition

  • Improve the accessibility of financing and/or benefit from better rates
  • Provide an additional avenue to finance a wider range of debtors, enhancing cash flow predictability

Picture 16. Manage receivables financing agreements

Capabilities 

  • Allow the customer to pay the funder directly for both receivables that have already been financed and those that are not selected for financing
  • Generate bank statements with reconciliation information of both financed and non-financed receivables for each company code and currency
  • Enable automatic clearing of financed receivables and settlement of corresponding receivables financing documents

For more information, see Receivables Financing

Back to top

Dynamic discounting: enable suppliers to receive early payment on outstanding invoices (self-funded) with credit memo

A new discount type, Discount by Credit Memo, has been introduced for the dynamic discounting scenario in Payables Financing. For dynamic discounting, it is now possible to create a dedicated credit memo as a separate document to reflect the discount amount.

Value Proposition

  • Allow suppliers to request early payment in exchange for a discount in those jurisdictions which require a secondary document to report deductions in trade payables and value-added tax (VAT) liabilities to tax authorities
  • Easily comply with reporting requirements in certain countries/regions
  • Enable the harmonization of the technical representation of dynamic discounting in global programs

Picture 17. Payables financing order

Capabilities

  • Create and post a credit memo for the discount amount once agreed upon by the supplier and buyer
  • Create a payables financing order automatically with the Discount by Credit Memo type in the Display Payables Financing Orders app and include the leading invoice and credit memo as line items of the financing order
  • Post the discount amount to a dedicated G/L account defined in configuration
  • Adjust the VAT amount of the credit memo during posting
  • Facilitate netting of the credit memo with the leading invoice at time of payment 

For more information, see Payables Financing and Dynamic Discounting with Credit Memos

Back to top

Contract Accounting   

Dunning by collection strategy on provider contract item level

During dunning by collection strategy, you can group the master data of business partners in master data groups. The dunning activity run then considers the group as a whole. This means that the system performs the necessary dunning activities separately for each master data group.. 

Value Proposition

  • Enable flexible dunning with item-level collection strategies for provider contracts.

Picture 18. FI-CA: dunning by collection strategy

Capabilities

In the system configuration, you can now define default values for the master data group when you define a collection strategy and master data group in the provider contracts of your business partners.

For more information, see: Grouping Master Data

Back to top

Subledger Transfer of documents from FI-CA to FI-AR/AP

If you map business processes in Contract Accounting and Accounts Receivable Accounting and Accounts Payable Accounting, you can consolidate the posting processes of Contract Accounting in Accounts Receivable and Accounts Payable Accounting by forwarding the postings generated in Contract Accounting to Accounts Receivable and Accounts Payable Accounting. 

Value Proposition

  • Enable seamless receivables management for your subscription business.

Picture 19. Transfer Documents to Accounts Receivable/Payable app (F8633)

Capabilities

With the move to a subscription-based model, you can streamline invoicing using Convergent Invoicing and manage receivables efficiently in Contract Accounting,  enabling scalable, automated financial processes tailored for recurring revenue.

During the transition, if you're running some business processes in Contract Accounting and others in Accounts Receivable or Payable, you can consolidate postings by forwarding Contract Accounting entries using the Transfer Documents to Accounts Receivable/Payable app (F8633).

For more information, see: Integration with Accounts Receivable Accounting and Accounts Payable Accounting

Back to top

Clearing Status in Business Partner Line items

The Manage Documents app visualizes the clearing status as a flow, with each processing step represented by a specific icon..

Value Proposition

  • Track and understand your payment flows with ease, from open items to cleared transactions, all visualized in one place in the Manage Documents App (F6109)

Picture 20. FI-CA: Manage documents - clearing status 

Capabilities

The Manage Documents app now visualizes the clearing status as a flow. Also, for each business partner item, whether open or cleared, the app displays a corresponding clearing flow. For open items, the app predicts which bank details or payment card data are likely to be used for clearing. For cleared items, it shows the actual clearing flow, including each processing step, whether via direct debit, payment card, payment order, or an internal process such as a write-off.

Each processing step is represented by a specific icon. To view details, click the icon.

For more information, see: Manage Documents

Back to top

Group Reporting           

One-click consolidation in a new consolidation monitor (cloud)

After collecting and preparing your financial data in the Data Monitor app, you must consolidate this data by performing tasks. With the Consolidation Monitor (New Version) app, you can use a modern user interface with the latest SAP Fiori technology (such as filtering options) to perform these tasks.

Value Proposition

  • Improve usability by replacing the existing app with a new app with a modern user interface
  • Increase efficiency by offering actions on multiple values of tasks, groups, and periods
  • Increase efficiency by automating task processing through task scheduling

Picture 21. Consolidation Monitor (New Version)

Capabilities

  • Show a list of tasks with detailed status information
  • Filter by versions and (multiple) consolidation groups, periods, tasks, or statuses
  • Enable multitask actions, such as run, block, and unblock
  • Enable multiple period actions including opening or closing periods
  • Process multiple fiscal year periods by grouping in one process year period
  • Support the scheduling of remaining tasks (such as custom tasks)
  • Schedule an entire monitor

For more information, see Consolidation Monitor (New Version)

Back to top

Consolidation auto-post rules engine: automation of consolidation unit dependent postings

This feature enables you to automatically post group journal entries by running consolidation tasks in the data monitor.

Value Proposition

  • Increase flexibility of the rule definition compared to existing annual net income calculation and reclassifications
  • Increase efficiency by automating more consolidation unit-related postings

Picture 22. Manage Rules for Automatic Postings app (F8339)

Capabilities

  • Automate consolidation unit-related postings (data monitor) on posting levels 00, 0C, 01, and 10 by creating flexible posting rules and rule groups using the Manage Rules for Automatic Postings app (F8339).
  • Replace the annual net income calculation and reclassifications in the data monitor.

For more information, see: Automatic Postings and Rules for Automatic Postings

Back to top

Consolidation auto-post rules engine: automation of intercompany eliminations postings

This feature enables you to automatically post group journal entries for pairs of consolidation units by running consolidation tasks in the consolidation monitor. It allows you to eliminate intercompany transactions, such as sales, other income/expenses, and accounts receivable/accounts payable, for example.

Value Proposition

  • Increase flexibility of rule definition as compared to reclassifications

Capabilities

  • Automate consolidation unit pair-related postings (consolidation monitor) on posting level 20 by creating flexible posting rules and rule groups using the Manage Rules for Automatic Postings app (F8339).
  • Partner Units filter available in rule definition

For more information, see: Automatic Postings for Pairs of Consolidation Units

Back to top

Contract and Lease Management

Cost settlement for real estate scenarios, such as automated cost classification

Categorize expenses and maintain all master data relevant for the cost settlement process with the Manage Service Groups app.

Manage and maintain contract-specific settlement regulations with the Manage Contract Settlement Regulations app. 

Synchronize or check journal entry items that are relevant for the cost settlement process with the Synchronize Cost Settlement Related Items app. By default, the journal entry items are synchronized and classified.

Classify the journal entry items to be considered in the cost settlement process with the Classify Journal Entry Items app.

Value Proposition

Increase efficiency and enhance the experience for users running real estate and contract management processes.

Picture 23. Manage service groups

Capabilities

  • New cost settlement process to allocate the costs to the participating real estate objects
  • New master data object service group as the basis for the entire cost settlement process
  • Flexible settlement hierarchy based on architecture objects, usable and rentable objects, as well as CLM contracts
  • Classification of incoming invoices and other journal entry items to prepare for the cost settlement

For more information, see: Configuration Activities

Back to top

SAP Green Ledger     

Enriching material movements from SAP S/4HANA with imported emission quantities

With this feature you can read journal entries related to material movements from your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system and generate carbon collections and carbon journal entries by copying accounts and account assignments and enriching them with imported emission quantities from SAP Sustainability Footprint Management for materials of a plant.

Value Proposition

  • Reduce manual efforts for completing generated carbon collection documents and allocation journal entries by entering emission quantities.
  • Ensure data quality by consistently copying financial attributes from the journal entries in your finance business system.
  • Increase the efficiency of the carbon collection process.
  • Benefit from using calculated product carbon footprints from SAP Sustainability Management.

 

Video 7. SAP Green Ledger - carbon journal entries based on material movements 

Capabilities

  • Import emission quantities from SAP Sustainability Footprint Management for materials of a plant.
  • Enrich the generated carbon collection documents and carbon journal entries with the imported emission quantities.

For more information, see: Import Material Movements

Back to top

Enabling automatic allocations of carbon quantities by reflecting allocations in financial accounting

With automatic allocation, you can retrieve financial flow data from the connected business system. This feature automatically determines receiver percentages for allocation and identifies the accounts or cost centers involved.

Value Proposition

  • Reduces manual effort by automatically calculating receiver percentages and generating allocation-related journal entries.
  • Enable consistent allocation of carbon quantities based on existing financial data, ensuring alignment between financial and sustainability reporting.
  • By using monetary allocations as the basis, carbon quantities are distributed more precisely and reflect true operational impact.

 

Video 8. Demo: SAP Green Ledger - allocate carbon quantities

Capabilities

  • Analyse posted journal entries resulting from allocations between cost objects in financial accounting of the SAP S/4HANA suite
  • Allocate carbon quantities proportionally between cost objects based on how monetary amounts were allocated in financial accounting

For more information, see: Automatically Allocate Carbon Data | SAP Help Portal

Back to top

Posting and analysis of carbon quantities on external suppliers and affiliated companies

By using suppliers and trading partners from the SAP S/4HANA Finance system, you gain more insights into the carbon emissions caused by certain suppliers. This allows for an overall better understanding of the emissions that result from business activities between affiliated companies.

Value Proposition

  • Improved decision-making process by gaining insights into carbon emissions of different suppliers
  • Improved understanding of emissions that result from business activities between affiliated companies
  • Enable reporting on corporate group level by providing emission quantities with trading partner information to SAP Group Reporting

Picture 24. SAP Green Ledger: carbon collection

Capabilities

  • Support suppliers and trading partners from your Finance business system
  • Collect carbon quantities with supplier and trading partner information
  • Support supplier-specific carbon quantities for purchased goods and services
  • Analyze carbon quantities for suppliers and trading partners
  • Provide balances with trading partner information to SAP Group Reporting as a basis for intercompany elimination


For more information, see: Import Master Data.

Configurations in CPI and Special handling of Business objects in Multiple Company integration

In this part, I’ll walk through the SAP Cloud Integration configurations needed to enable the multiple FSM company integration feature. I’ll also highlight some special handling considerations for specific business object types in this setup.

Blog Series links:

Part 1 - Multiple Company integration overview and preparing S/4HANA systems for Multi-Company Integration

Part 2 - Configurations in CPI and Special handling of Business objects in Multiple Company integration

Part 3 - Achieving Multiple Company integration through custom logic implementation and enhanced error logging

Once the multi-company mapping configuration is completed in the S/4HANA system (as described in Part 1 of this blog series), the next step is to synchronize this mapping data into SAP Cloud Integration as a Value Mapping.

To achieve this:

  1. Configure the Synchronize Multiple Company Mapping Configuration interface according to the standard configuration guide.
  2. Deploy the interface.

When deployed, this process automatically creates a new value mapping artifact:

“Value Mapping for Multiple Company determination in SAP Field Service Management from SAP S/4HANA”

This artifact is stored in the same integration package and is deployed automatically.
It contains all the mapping configuration details in the following format:

The code list values are automatically created by the synchronization interface. For different rule type, the code list values are defined as per below logic:

In addition to this multiple company value mapping, the synchronization interface will also create a datastore object in SAP Cloud Integration named “FSMCompanyList”, this data store holds the full list of accountId and companyId pairs configured in the multiple company configuration in S4HANA system. This datastore will be utilized in the cases when the business object type is set to replicate all FSM companies using “ALLCOMPANIES” configuration.

After the successful deployment of the multiple company value mapping in the SAP CPI, you need to update the below interfaces to enable multiple company functionality by setting the “EnableMultiCompanyReplication” parameter to true.

 

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Integration package (Integration of Service in SAP S/4HANA Cloud with SAP Field Service Management)

Enabling this parameter will make the standard interfaces to invoke the Multiple Company integration logic. The interfaces will call the multiple company value mapping to fetch to identify the relevant SAP FSM company id and account id to which the business data to be replicated. This logic is identified in the “Fetch FSM Company” in each interface. Once the FSM company and account id’s are fetched, they are appended to the same incoming message as <FSMAccountID>|<FSMCompanyID> shown below.

Also, the data will be grouped for each FSM account ID and company ID pair for processing into FSM. Each grouped xml message will have the MultiCompanyGroup attribute with corresponding accountId|companyId value. For reference:

If no company Id is found from value mapping for the incoming data, then the account and company IDs are maintained as “NA|NA” and the respective data will be filtered out for replication into FSM. Such data will not be replicated to any SAP FSM company.

Special cases in Multiple FSM company data replication:

When working with multiple company integration between SAP S/4HANA and SAP Field Service Management (FSM), there are a few special cases to be aware of:

  1. No Matching FSM Company ID: If no FSM Company ID is found in the multiple company value mapping, the related data is filtered out and not replicated to any FSM company.
  2. In the integration between SAP S/4HANA Public cloud to SAP FSM
    1. Contact Data Handling:
      • Contact data is stored in the SAP CPI Data Store named BPContacts.
      • A contact is replicated only if it is assigned to a Business Partner.
      • The FSM Company ID is determined from the associated Business Partner using the multiple company mapping rules in the S/4HANA configuration for the Business Partner object.
      • Contacts are loaded into FSM together with their relationship replication.
    2. Data Retention:
      • By default, contact data remains in the CPI Data Store for 30 days.
      • Retention can be extended up to 180 days by adjusting the DS-ExpirationPeriod parameter.
    3. Business Partner Address:
      • FSM Company identification for Business Partner Address data is derived by the parent Business Partner interface, based on the Business Partner object itself.

In the integration between SAP S/4HANA Private cloud and SAP FSM

  1. Employee Data:
    • Employees are replicated to all FSM companies configured in S/4HANA mapping.
    • Assignment to a Service Organization is done later using the Assign Service Employee interface.
  2. Deactivating Unassigned Employees:
    • Employees not linked to any Service Organization can be deactivated using the Delete Business Partner Employee interface, run on an ad-hoc basis.
  3. Contact Data:
    • Contacts are replicated to all FSM companies as inactive.
    • They are activated only when linked to a Business Partner in S/4HANA, together with the relationship replication.
    • Company identification for contacts is based on the associated Business Partner.
  4. Item Group Data:
    • Item groups are replicated to all FSM companies configured in the S/4HANA multiple company mapping.

4. The Service Orders can only to replicated to any one FSM company based on the Sales Area or based on any specific field or using custom logic rule type as defined in the multiple company mapping configuration in S/4HANA. Replicating a single Service Order to multiple FSM companies is not recommended due to conflicts in Service Call ID acknowledgment.

 

This completes the configuration required in the SAP Cloud Integration to enable the multiple company integration functionality. Further, I will share the details on implementing the custom logic functionality to fetch the FSM Company

To be continued…

Seamless Multi-Company Data Replication in SAP Field Service Management - Part 1

The SAP Field Service Management (FSM) landscape is built on two key components: the Account and the Company. While the Account acts as the highest organizational level, a Company represents a specific legal entity, department, or business unit. This structure allows customers to manage multiple companies within a single FSM system to align with their business units. However, this creates a common challenge—replicating data from SAP S/4HANA to multiple FSM Companies. Data replication rules often vary depending on factors like Sales Area, Plant, Company Code, or Purchasing Group.

The standard integration content previously had a limitation, allowing data to be sent to only one FSM company at a time from S/4HANA Public or Private Cloud systems. With the 2023 FPS03 release, this limitation has been addressed—enabling standard integration from S/4HANA to multiple FSM Companies.

In this blog series, I’ll explore this new multi-company integration capability for both from S/4HANA public and private cloud system perspective. I’ll also share edge cases where implementing custom logic can help determine the correct FSM Company based on incoming S/4HANA data.

Blog Series links:

Part 1 - Multiple Company integration overview and preparing S/4HANA systems for Multi-Company Integration

Part 2 - Configurations in CPI and Special handling of Business objects in Multiple Company integration

Part 3 - Achieving Multiple Company integration through custom logic implementation and enhanced error logging

entry.title: Seamless Multi-Company Data Replication in SAP Field Service Management – Part 3
entry.content:
Custom Logic in Pre exits and Error Handling in Multiple FSM Company Replication in SAP Cloud Integration

In this blog part, I’ll explain how to use custom exits within the multiple company fetch functionality of standard interfaces to determine the relevant FSM company. I’ll also highlight the enhanced error handling introduced in SAP Cloud Integration as part of the multiple company integration feature.

Blog Series links:

Part 1 - Multiple Company integration overview and preparing S/4HANA systems for Multi-Company Integration

Part 2 - Configurations in CPI and Special handling of Business objects in Multiple Company integration

Part 3 - Achieving Multiple Company integration through custom logic implementation and enhanced error logging

Sometimes, the standard rule types provided by SAP—such as Sales Area, Company Code, etc—may not fit your business requirements for identifying the FSM company. In such cases, you can implement your own custom logic to determine the FSM Company IDs and Account IDs for incoming data. This custom logic can be implemented in multiple ways, depending on your integration scenario and business needs.

.

Custom Logic Using Pre-Exits for Multiple Company in Standard Interfaces:

In the S/4HANA Public Cloud to SAP FSM integration, you can leverage a pre-exit to determine FSM company details dynamically.

To enable this:

  1. In the standard interface where you want to apply custom logic, set the parameter Enable Pre-Exit MultiCompany to true.
  2. Create a Process Direct interface to implement your custom logic for setting FSM Account IDs and Company IDs.
  3. Apply your business rules to assign one or multiple companies as required.

This approach gives you flexibility to map FSM companies based on your specific business criteria before the data is sent to FSM.

 

Sample custom interface with custom logic to identify the FSM company and account id for the business partner object.

In the Groovy step “Set FSM Company details”, I have logic to different FSM account and company based on country code and for the FLCU01 role code. The identified FSM account and company details are appended to the same Business Partner message as in below format.

Similarly, this logic can be extended to any extent as per your requirement.

<FSMMultiCompany>
  <FSMCompany>accountid1|companyidA</FSMCompany>
  <FSMCompany>accountid1|companyidB</FSMCompany>
  .
  .
</FSMMultiCompany>

Later in the XSLT step “XSLT Group by FSM Company”, the message is grouped per FSM account and company Id pair using xml attribute “MultiCompanyGroup” as accountid|companyid. This group of data per each FSM account and company pair is required for the further processing of the data into each FSM company by the standard interface. More detail on how to group the message is provided in the following link Multiple Company Pre-Exits.

Final payload which sent back to standard Replicate Business Partner interface is as below. The standard interface will take care of posting the BP data to each FMS company in sequential batches.

In scenario of S/4HANA Private Cloud to SAP FSM integration scenario, you can either use the similar approach of using the pre exits provided for the multiple company fetch in the standard interfaces as shown above OR you can set the rule type as “Custom” in the S/4HANA multiple company configuration for the business object and implement a BADI to identify the FSM company ID in S4HANA.

 

Custom Logic Using Custom rule type in Multiple Company config in S/4HANA:

The Custom Logic rule type is available only for integration between SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud and SAP Field Service Management (FSM).

This option allows you to determine the relevant FSM companies using your own code or logic instead of predefined rules. To use it:

  • Create an implementation for the BAdI CRMS4_FSM_RELV_COMP_DETERM.
  • Assign the Custom Logic rule type to the desired Replication Object, Attribute, and Attribute Value in the multiple company configuration.
  • Use the same combination as a filter in your BAdI implementation.
  • If Custom Logic is required for multiple replication objects, create a separate BAdI implementation for each.

Example: To configure custom logic for Sales Customers:

Step 1: Assign Custom Logic Rule Type

  • Replication Object: Business Partner (BP)
  • Replication Object Attribute: BP Role (02)
  • Replication Object Attribute Value: BP Customer – Sales (FLCU01)

Step 2: Create BAdI Implementation with Filters

  • Replication Object (REPL_OBJECT): Business Partner (BP)
  • Replication Object Attribute (OBJ_ATR): BP Role (02)
  • Replication Object Attribute Value (OBJ_ATR_VAL): BP Customer – Sales (FLCU01)

This approach gives you full flexibility to define custom company determination logic that fits your organization’s business rules, while keeping it aligned with the multiple company integration framework.

 

Enhanced Error Logging in Multi-Company integrations:

In multi-company integration scenarios, SAP Cloud Integration now provides enhanced error logging to simplify troubleshooting and root cause analysis.

When data errors occur during replication to SAP Field Service Management (FSM) companies, the system:

  • Creates attachments in the Message Processing Log (MPL) with detailed error information.
  • Records custom MPL headers indicating the FSM company for which the data failed to load.
  • Generates separate attachments for each FSM company, ensuring issue tracking is company-specific.

If an error is generic (not linked to a specific FSM company), it is still logged in a custom MPL header containing the company and account ID, along with relevant attachments.

Handling Missing Company Assignments

When no FSM company can be determined for an incoming replication object, the object is filtered out and not sent to any FSM company.

  • These filtered object IDs are recorded in a dedicated custom MPL header.
  • All attachment file names are suffixed with the corresponding FSM company ID.
  • If multiple companies are determined for one replication object, separate attachments are created for each.
